required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cell Therapy for CD7 Positive Acute Leukemia or Mixed Lineage Leukemia Except Those Who Are Diagnosed With T-ALL/T-LBL Using CD7-Specific CAR-T Cells
clinical_study.official_title: Cell Therapy for CD7 Positive Acute Leukemia or Mixed Lineage Leukemia Except Those Who Are Diagnosed With T-ALL/T-LBL Using CD7-Specific CAR-T Cells

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open, single-arm, clinical study to evaluate efficacy and safety of anti CD7 CAR-T cell in the treatment of CD7 Positive acute leukemia or mixed lineage leukemia except those who are diagnosed with T-ALL/T-LBL

detailed_description.textblock:
The CARs consist of an anti-CD7 single-chain variable fragment（scFv）, a portion of the human CD137（4-1BB） molecule, and the intracellular component of the human CD3ζ molecule. Prior to CAR-T cell infusion, the patients will be subjected to preconditioning treatment. After CAR-T cell infusion, the patients will be evaluated for adverse reactions and efficacy.
The Main research objectives:
To evaluate the safety and efficacy of CD7 CAR-T cells in patients with CD7 Positive acute leukemia or mixed lineage leukemia except those who are diagnosed with T-ALL/T-LBL
The Secondary research objectives:
To investigate the cytokinetic characteristics of CD7 CAR-T cells in patients with CD7 Positive acute leukemia or mixed lineage leukemia except those who are diagnosed with T-ALL/T-LBL

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Incidence and severity of adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: First 1 month post CAR-T cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the possible adverse events occurred within first one month after CD7 CAR-T infusion, including the incidence and severity of symptoms such as cytokine release syndrome and neurotoxicity

In the presence of extramedullary lesions, complete remission (CR), partial remission (PR), stable disease (SD), disease recurrence or progression (PD) shall be used to describe extramedullary lesions

secondary_outcome.description: the copy number of CD7 CAR- T cells in the genomes of PBMC by qPCR method
percentage of CD7 CAR- T cells measured by flow cytometry method

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 1 month post CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Cytokine( IL-6,IL-10,IFN-γ,TNF-α ) concentration (pg/mL) by flow cytometry method

the peak concentration of Senl-T7 CAR-T cells amplified in the peripheral blood (Cmax, detected by flow cytometry and qPCR); the time taken to reach the peak concentration (Tmax), and the persistent time of the Senl-T7 CAR-T cells in vivo in patients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 1 month post CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: the pharmacodynamic change in the clearance of peripheral blood CD7+ cells and the release of the cytokines at each observation time point

clinical_study.condition: CD7+ Acute Leukemia or Mixed Lineage Leukemia

intervention.description: Biological: CD7 CAR-T; Drug: Cyclophosphamide,Fludarabine; Procedure: Leukapheresis

facility.name: He bei Yan da Lu dao pei Hospital
